why: Establish a very basic baseline performance.
what: Train LightGBM on a single fold of the data.
how: Use train_single_fold.py utility with a default LGBM configuration. No special feature engineering.

why: Get a more robust performance estimate using cross-validation.
what: Train LightGBM using all CV folds.
how: Use train_and_cv.py utility with default LGBM configuration.

why: Assess the impact of basic categorical feature handling.
what: Train LightGBM using CV folds with basic categorical encoding.
how: Modify 03_c script/config to include encode_categorical_features.py (e.g., OneHotEncoding) before training.

why: Evaluate an alternative gradient boosting model.
what: Train XGBoost using all CV folds.
how: Use train_and_cv.py utility with default XGBoost configuration.

why: Check if a simple ensemble improves over individual models.
what: Create an average ensemble of multi-fold LGBM and XGBoost predictions.
how: Use average_predictions.py utility on the OOF/test predictions from experiments C and E.

why: Rerun Exp G (XGB+Combinations+TE) on FULL data
what: Train XGBoost with extensive FE including N-way label encoded combinations and TE on full data.
how: Load ext data, clip, map, poly/agg/N-way(label) feats, OOF TE, KFold(7) XGB training.

why: Adapt Exp G (XGB) to LGBM with full data
what: Train LGBM with extensive FE including N-way label encoded combinations and TE
how: Load ext data, clip, map, poly/agg/N-way(label) feats, OOF TE, KFold(7) LGBM training.

why: Test L2 objective in LGBM based on Exp H
what: Train LGBM (L2 objective) with extensive FE including N-way label encoded combinations and TE
how: Same as Exp H but objective=regression_l2.

why: Replace TE with CE in Exp I (LGBM L2)
what: Train LGBM (L2 objective) with extensive FE including N-way label encoded combinations and Count Encoding
how: Same as Exp I but apply_count_encoding used instead of apply_target_encoding.

why: Average Ensemble of Exp g, h, i, j
what: Average OOF/Test predictions from Exp g, h, i, j
how: Load .npy files from g, h, i, j, calculate np.mean, save results.

why: Weighted Ensemble (0.4, 0.2, 0.2, 0.2) of Exp g, h, i, j
what: Weighted avg OOF/Test predictions from Exp g, h, i, j (Weights: 0.4, 0.2, 0.2, 0.2)
how: Load .npy files from g, h, i, j, calculate np.average with weights 0.4, 0.2, 0.2, 0.2, save results.
